answerText: Republic of Equatorial Guinea[10] Apart from Equatorial Guinea, Spain claims two exclaves bordering Morocco. The Strait of Gibraltar separates them from contiguous Spain. Name either.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 9 | 11 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This nation consists of the islands of Annobon and Bioko, as well as a mainland region called Rio Buni. For 10 points each: [10] Name this only African country where Spanish is an official language.
